caption: A tiny cemetery, next to the seventeenth-century church of St Germain in Charonne in the 20th arrondissement, holds the remains of Fran√ßois Begue, alias Magloire. The epitaph reveals to the living and to the four winds what had never been and what in life he had managed to make everyone believe, painter, patriot, poet and perhaps Robespierre's secretary. The statue is at the top of the cemetery and still seems to observe the other poor souls with whom it shares this strip of land - so much for the haters!

graves of known people, unknown people, a cat is almost permanently there, around a historic Parisian building! this church was that of the village of Charonne. Recent ground stabilization work has allowed some real finds in the basement. some explanations in the church.   Communards are buried here, respect for their struggle, their hopes, their heroism. around a popular neighborhood...
Small cemetery next to the St-Germain de Charonne church

I go there regularly, on average three times a week. The place is serene, calming and the presence of the three ‚Äúguide‚Äù cats is very appreciated, even by tourists... But too often closed (bad weather has its back!) üü•
Picturesque little provincial-style cemetery located just above the very interesting and very old Saint-Germain de Charonne church. Some graves of great famous writers.
We can forget that we are in Paris
